The narrative is messy. The game is burdened by uninteresting new characters. Almost every character in the game feels like an inhuman caricature of what a person is supposed to be like. The main characters are so artificial that they can hardly be taken seriously\, which discredits the story. The cutscenes are extremely overly gratuitous (both in violence and in sexuality)\, to the point that it’s offensive. Several sections of the game seem to severely overstay their welcome. The gameplay itself is more varied than that of its predecessor\, but this one positive is marred by the fact that the game is simpler and easier than its predecessor\, contributing to the fact that the game is flat out boring in some parts.    After playing The Last of Us Part II\, it’s clear to see that N**l **ckmann hated J**l\, and hated the original game\, as this game desperately tried to alienate itself from its predecessor\, while trying ever so hard to create a new and different identity for itself. Unfortunately\, The Last of Us Part II will only be remembered as a loud and ugly failure. I feel sorry for the those who fell in love with The Last of Us in 2013\, who waited 7 years only to be so incredibly disappointed and aggressively disrespected. I feel sorry for the developers who had no say in the game’s direction\, who knew full well that the game they were working tirelessly on would be received poorly.
